Texto: 
tenderness to palpation in right upper quadrant.  elevated white blood cell count.  the remainder of the exam was unremarkable.
the patient underwent a laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
a thickened gallbladder wall is shown.  echogenic shadowing foci are seen dependently.  a small amount of pericholecystic fluid is noted.  a sonographic murphys' sign was noted on exam.
acute cholecystitis
acute cholecystitis
emphysematous cholecystitis
51 year old male with 2 week history of right upper quadrant colicky pain, worse after eating.
none
